I was wrong. Within 30 minutes I broke out in hives. I had 3 on my face, several on my arms and legs. The hives stopped after the initial breakout and although I was worried, I was keen to just keep watch and not go the ER. They finally went down about 24 hours later. I spent the night being very anxious / paranoid and feeling really off in general. I took two doses of Benedryl and it’s now been 36 hours and I feel fine but it was scary. Using this drug was like living in a nightmare. It still remains to be see whether it helped my prostatitis; I was given 28-day course of 56 pills at a combined 960mg tablet. But while using it, I had many profound negative side effects: extreme anxiety, racing thoughts, and pounding heart that did not respond to various self-soothing techniques such as mediation, breathing, or even a cold shower; insomnia to the point I didn’t sleep but a few minutes a night for my last three days on the drug; various flu-like symptoms such as mild fever, fatigue, chills and hot flashes, weakness, and cognitive ability loss; and an out-of-body feeling. I stopped taking it after eight pills when I noticed the symptoms always ramped up 15-30 minutes after taking a dose. Before that I didn’t connect these insane symptoms to my new medication, but I probably should have because I had a similar reaction to another antibiotic, levofloxacin, a couple of years ago. Be very wary of this drug!
